strapiPost.title: AR-112 Construction Project Unearths Ancient Artifacts
strapiPost.content:
The Commonwealth Heritage Group has been called in to excavate a significant archaeological site found during a survey for the upcoming Hwy 112 expansion project near the Blessings Golf Club.

  • Dig this: Estimated to be 6,000-9,000 years old, the site is thought to have been home to a community of 30-50 people living in huts surrounding a 30 ft cookhouse filled with fire hearths. Senior archaeologist Jack Rossen called it the most significant archaeological site he's seen in Arkansas.
  • Ancient artifacts: The site will be excavated and artifacts taken to Memphis to gain insight into the lifestyle of the people who once lived there before the site it cleared to make way for the highway construction.

Read more on the story from 5News HERE.
